author: Special Correspondent
text:
Bank officials in the district have been apprised about the standard operating procedures devised by the Election Commission on confiscation of cash by flying squads.

The meeting assumed significance in the wake of the squads seizing money belonging to banks during the course of transport in vehicles to ATM centres without proper documents at periodic intervals ever since the model code of conduct came into effect.

District Collector and Election Officer S. Prabakar instructed the officials to unfailingly provide the necessary documents while transporting cash to ATMs.

The flying squads that act on the basis of the complaints routed to them through the control room at the collectorate will necessarily seize the cash if there is no documentary proof.

Banks have to maintain separate entries of transactions by customers in excess of Rs. one lakh and Rs. 10 lakh.

Information about customers who redeem jewellery for excessive amounts must also be passed on to the control room, the Collector said.

Campaign expenses

Flying squads have been vested by the Election Commission with the responsibility of keeping vigil over excessive campaign expenses, distribution of items as bribe in cash or in kind, movement of illegal arms, ammunition, liquor or anti-social elements in the constituencies assigned to them. The vehicles used by flying squads and static surveillance teams have been fitted with GPRS enabled tracking unit to monitor their timely action, the bank officials were told.
title: Transport cash to ATMs with documents, banks told
